intro: Funastrum apiculatum, commonly known as the mountain holly or red holly, is a shrub native to the southern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Phyllanthaceae and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves with a distinctive red or purple underside. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by red, fleshy berries that are an important food source for wildlife. Funastrum apiculatum is typically found in rocky or limestone soils in woodland and scrub habitats. It is a hardy, drought-tolerant species that thrives in full sun to partial shade.
